data.name: Any base number to decimal
data.description:
Convert any based number (base 2, base 8, up to base 16) to its integer value, without using the `.to_i(base)` method.

Note: hexadecimal and other bases above 10 is uppercase only â€” `F` not `f`.

```ruby
base_to_n('0', 2) # => 0
base_to_n('1', 2) # => 1
base_to_n('10', 2) # => 2
base_to_n('1000110010', 2) # => 562

base_to_n('07', 8) # => 7
base_to_n('10', 8) # => 8
base_to_n('11', 8) # => 9
base_to_n('20', 8) # => 16

base_to_n('10', 10) # => 10
base_to_n('20', 10) # => 20

base_to_n('1', 16) # => 1
base_to_n('9', 16) # => 9
base_to_n('F', 16) # => 15
base_to_n('0F', 16) # => 15
base_to_n('10', 16) # => 16
base_to_n('20', 16) # => 32
base_to_n('FF', 16) # => 255
base_to_n('FFFF', 16) # => 65535
```
